intro: Brassica campestris f. auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate cabbage, is a botanical variant of the turnip family. It is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-like) leaves that give it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces yellow flowers in the shape of a cross, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Its leaves are edible and can be used in various culinary applications. This cultivar is valued for both its ornamental qualities and its potential agricultural uses.
